meanings.definition: A path alongside a canal or river where horses or vehicles can pull boats.
meanings.sent1: Families enjoy walking along the towpaths to see the boats.
meanings.sent2: The cyclists rode their bikes on the towpaths next to the river.
meanings.sent3: The ducks quacked happily as they waddled along the towpaths.
meanings.sent4: The towpaths were like ribbons guiding the boats through the water.
meanings.sent5: The sunlit towpaths shimmered with the reflections of passing boats.
